summary: This document is an email chain forwarding Amazon's response to a subpoena (Ref. No. CRIM 1071168 2020 DS, In Re: Subpoena 20 Mag. 6216) from the FBI. Amazon's Law Enforcement Response Team manager, Teresa Rodelo, provides a spreadsheet response with redactions and notes objections to the request's volume and burden.

persons.name: Teresa Rodelo
persons.role: Manager, Law Enforcement Response Team at Amazon.com, Inc.
persons.context: She is the sender of the email from Amazon providing the company's response to the FBI subpoena, noting redactions and legal objections.

persons.name: Will
persons.role: Contractor or staff member at US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: Addressed in the forwarding email to create a folder for the document in a shared drive and update a spreadsheet tracker for subpoena returns.

connections.description: Teresa Rodelo sends Amazon's subpoena response to the FBI/US Attorney's Office, and the email is forwarded internally to Will for document management.

events.title: Amazon Subpoena Response Submission
events.description: Teresa Rodelo of Amazon sends the company's response to a subpoena (Ref. No. CRIM 1071168 2020 DS) to the FBI, including a redacted spreadsheet and legal objections.

locations: Seattle, WA 98121 (Amazon.com, Inc. address at 2021 7th Avenue)
keyFacts: Amazon received a law enforcement subpoena (Ref. No. CRIM 1071168 2020 DS, In Re: Subpoena 20 Mag. 6216) related to the Epstein case.
Amazon's response included redactions of 'titles of expressive materials' for privacy and legal reasons.
Amazon objected to the subpoena as 'unusually voluminous' and potentially causing 'an undue burden'.
The communication shows coordination within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) to track subpoena returns.
